problems.title: Contains Duplicate II
problems.description:
Given an integer array nums and an integer k, return true if there are two distinct indices i and j in the array such that nums[i] == nums[j] and abs(i - j) <= k.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print "true" if such indices exist, otherwise "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4 3
1 2 3 1

Sample Output
true

Explanation:
nums[0] == 1 and nums[3] == 1, and abs(0 - 3) = 3 <= 3.
hintsList: Use a sliding window or a hash set to store elements in the current window of size k.
If an element is already in the set, return true. If the set size exceeds k, remove the oldest element.
